        public static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Cell getCell(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row,
                                                       int index)
        Returns the specified cell or null if the cell is undefined.
        Parameters:
        row - the row where the cell is located
        index - the 0-based column number
        Returns:
        the specified cell or null

      • getCell

                                                       String colref)
        Returns the specified cell or null if the cell is undefined.
        Parameters:
        row - the row where the cell is located
        colref - the letter reference of the column
        Returns:
        the specified cell or null

      • getOrCreateCell

        public static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Cell getOrCreateCell(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row,
                                                               int index)
        Returns the specified cell. If the cell does not exist it is created.

        The cell-style will be inherited from default styles in the following order: the row column, then the default column style, and finally the default workbook style.

        Parameters:
        row - the row where the cell is located
        index - the 0-based column index
        Returns:
        the specified cell

      • getOrCreateCell

        public static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Cell getOrCreateCell(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row,
                                                               String colref)
        Returns the specified cell. If the cell does not exist it is created.

        The cell-style will be inherited from default styles in the following order: the row column, then the default column style, and finally the default workbook style.

        Parameters:
        row - the row where the cell is located
        colref - the letter reference of the column
        Returns:
        the specified cell

      • getSheetOf

        public static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Sheet getSheetOf(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row)
        Returns the sheet that contains the specified row. If the row has been deleted this method will result in an exception.
        Parameters:
        row - the specified row
        Returns:
        the sheet which contains the specified row

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setStyle

        public static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row setStyle(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row,
                                                       org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.CellStyle style,
                                                       boolean update)
        Applies the cell-style to future and existing cells in the specified row.
        Parameters:
        row - the row to apply the cell-style to
        style - the specified cell-style
        update - whether or not to update existing cells
        Returns:
        the affected row

      • skipBlankCells

        public static Iterable<org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Cell> skipBlankCells(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row)
        Returns a view of the specified row skipping blank cells.

        A cell is considered blank if the Cells.formatValue(Cell) method returns an empty String, or a String composed of only whitespace characters, according to CharMatcher.whitespace().

        Parameters:
        row - the specified row
        Returns:
        a view of the specified row skipping blank cells

      • getLastCellIndex

        public static Optional<Integer> getLastCellIndex(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row)
        Returns the 1-based index of the last cell in the specified row or an empty Optional if the row has no defined cells.
        Parameters:
        row - the specified row
        Returns:
        the 1-based index of the last cell in the specified row or an empty Optional if the row has no defined cells

      • setValues

        public static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row setValues(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row,
                                                        int index,
                                                        Iterable<? extends Object> values)
        Sets a sequence of values in the given row, beginning at the specified cell. Any non-existent cells within the range are created. The values are set by calling Cells.setValue(Cell, Object).
        Parameters:
        row - the specified row
        index - the index of the starting cell
        values - the values to set
        Returns:
        the specified row

      • setValues

        public static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row setValues(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row,
                                                        String colref,
                                                        Iterable<? extends Object> values)
        Sets a sequence of values in the given row, beginning at the specified cell. Any non-existent cells within the range are created. The values are set by calling Cells.setValue(Cell, Object).
        Parameters:
        row - the specified row
        colref - the letter reference of the column
        values - the values to set
        Returns:
        the specified row
